subject: Swimming
lead_paragraph: Nike said Monday that it was leaving the elite swimwear market. The company said that it would continue to provide swimwear for colleges and sell to traditional retail customers, but that it would not compete against companies like Speedo for the world’s top swimmers. Nike said it made a “strategic decision as part of the company’s long-term growth plan.” At the Beijing Olympics, Speedo stole the spotlight with its LZR Racer suit. According to Speedo, 72 of the 77 world records set since the release of the suit in February have been by swimmers wearing LZR Racers — including Michael Phelps.
